author: Pranav Trewn
title: Cloak – “Regrow”
text:
Pranav Trewn @PTrewn | 10:01 am Share < br />this article: 
It’s been a good few years since we first heard from the Brooklyn-based electro-rockers Cloak, but fortunately the band is finally getting around to releasing their debut EP We Will All Be Equal Soon . “Regrow,” the project’s latest single, is as ominously acerbic as everything else we’ve heard from Cloak thus far, sounding like a cross between Baths and Crystal Castles. The blearing keyboards and choppy vocals have become something of Cloak’s signature at this point, but the flickering dream-pop flourishes are a welcome addition to the band’s M.O. The song’s oscillating tension never relents, with vocalist Sam Tyndall’s brooding lyrics locking the whole affair in the shadows: “Oh love my love just taste the blood and severing/ Just consider it our wedding ring/ Promise me.” I mean, damn. Yet credit to Cloak for making all this sound not dispiriting, but impossibly empowering. Listen below. 
We Will All Be Equal Soon is out 5/19. Pre-order it here . The band is playing a record release show May 27th at St. Vitus in Brooklyn alongside Mass Gothic.
